data.name: ATDFTDNoticeBody
data.value:
To record time in something other than a real airplane, create an aircraft of the type being simulated (e.g., Cessna 172 or Boeing 757) and identify it as being a simulator/FTD/ATD/etc.  The prefix "SIM" will be used for the tailnumber of such aircraft, so you won't have a tailnumber conflict with a real aircraft.

For example, if you have time in a Boeing 757 simulator, create an aircraft that is a Boeing 757, identify it as being an FTD or ATD, and it will be given a tailnumber like "SIMB757." Depending on the certification level, approaches/landings/etc. in the SIMB757 would then count towards currency in a Boeing 757.

When you record a flight in the sim, record the device's serial number or registration either in the comments for the flight, or, if you prefer, using the "Simulator/Training Device Identifier" property.

data.name: ChartTotalsHoursOfX
data.comment: e.g., hours of night flying, hours of instruction.

data.name: AnswerWhyCantEditSims
data.value:
This aircraft is a "virtual" aircraft that is either an unspecified instance of the representative model, or a training device that emulates that model. As such is shared by all pilots who want to fly a virtual version of this model with this set of capabilities (e.g., logging landings or approaches).

If you need to record training time in a training device that represents another model of aircraft, or with a different certification level, or in a different model without specifying a specific tailnumber, you can create a new virtual aircraft to represent that (if one already exists, it will be reused).

If you have existing flights that you would like to switch from one aircraft to another, contact us and we can do a bulk-edit for you.

data.name: LabelWhyCantEditSims
data.value: Why can't I edit this aircraft?

data.name: ImagesBackupFineprint
data.value: The ZIP file contains an HTML file and the thumbnail images; the full-size images are stored on Amazon Web Services. View the HTML file to view the images; click them to see the full-size image, and you can use an image downloading program to copy all of the full-sized images from Amazon.

data.name: ShareLogbookPrompt1
data.value: Share your logbook and more details

data.name: ShareLogbookPrompt2
data.value: Here you can create links that you can share with people to enable them to view aspects of your logbook. You can revoke these links, which will render them useless to people that have them.

data.name: SharePublicFlightsDescription
data.value: Anyone with this link can view the flights that you have indicated are visible to the public. You can't disable this link, but you can share or not share details for individual flights.

data.name: GratuityDescriptionClub
data.value: Anyone can create a club, but it will go inactive after a 30-day trial period. If the you make a one-time contribution at this level, then any club you create over the following year (or any inactive club you have previously created) will be active forever.

data.name: GratuityDescriptionDropbox
data.value: Of course, your data is already in the cloud and backed up! And you can link your account to Dropbox, OneDrive, or Google Drive and save a copy of your flights to any of these services at any time. This gratuity will "press the button" on your behalf every night for a year, giving you a nightly off-line spreadsheet with your flights.

data.name: GratuityDescriptionGratitude
data.value: Good karma and appreciation is yours for all of eternity...for a year!

data.name: GratuityDescriptionVideo
data.value: Videos are one of those few things where my costs go up the more they are used, so I ask for a contribution if you want videos. With this gratuity, you can add videos to your flights for a year. Videos remain after the year is up, but you can't upload new ones.

data.name: GratuityNameEternalGratitude
data.value: Enjoy a year's worth of eternal gratitude

data.name: GratuityThanksEternalGratitude
data.value: You will enjoy our eternal gratitude...until {0:d}

data.value: Your eternal gratitude from %APP_NAME% has ended

data.name: gratuityEternalGratitudeExpiring

data.name: GratuityDescriptionCurrencyNotification
data.value: Each night we check your currency, including things like medical expiration and flight reviews. If a currency gets close to its expiration - or expires - we'll send you an email notification!

data.name: GratuityNameCurrencyNotifications
data.value: Get notified when a currency will expire

data.name: BulkCreateFlightsFromTelemetryTitleDesc2
